content:
In earlier TB versions up to TB 60 there was only one profile (folder) named .default in the Profiles folder. Beginning with TB 68 the active profile was renamed in default-release and .default was degraded to a stub profile containing only a times.json file. More recently the .default-release profile became .default-esr and the stub profile .default was maintained. To add still more confusion, since 2024 TB issues a new monthly .default-release labelled version which is similar to the beta version.

To find out which of your profile folders in "Profiles" - .default or .default-release - contains your message, address book and calendar data you must open both and compare their contents.

content:
Arkadiusz Wierciński said
Hello, I have the Thunderbird application on 2 desktop computers. I have the same email addresses hooked up on them. In addition, we have the same email addresses set up on 2 smartphones (in the outlook app and gmail). At the moment it is the case that on computers when emails come in, they are marked as unread. The problem is then when the same emails come in on the smartphone, they immediately convert as read in Thunderbird, even though I haven't moved them at all on the smartphone. This applies to one email account. On another one it is so that in Thunderbird it is marked as unread all the time, but when I read it there, on the other computer in Thunderbird it is deselected and it is read, even though I have not opened it. Why is this happening? How to make all messages that fall into a particular Thubderbird to be marked as unread all the time, as long as we actually read them only in this particular program? I hope everything is understood

Hard to diagnose without knowing which accounts are POP or IMAP. With IMAP, a message that is read or deleted on one device is marked as read or deleted on other devices - that is synchronization. With POP, messages that are downloaded to one device without being deleted from the server, can be downloaded on other devices, but the actions on one device are not synchronized with other devices.

IMAP is almost always the best option for accounts on multiple devices, besides other advantages such as syncing all folders such as Sent, Junk, user-defined folders etc. POP downloads the Inbox only.

content: There is an addon, mailmerge, that lets you send an email and have individual copies go to recipients. But to do this with a higher degree of success, I encourage considering a mailing list company, such as Mailchimp (or others). Otherwise, you run the possibility of having your emails rejected or considered spam, or being blacklisted. There are many websites with info on mailing lists and their management. Thunderbird can send the messages, but the problem would more likely come from your email provider or recipients' email provider.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hi

The errror message:

Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail: Outgoing server (SMTP) error. The server responded: resomta-ch2-07v.sys.comcast.net resomta-ch2-07v.sys.comcast.net Excessive failed authentication, ESMTP server temporarily not available, please contact support.

Not a common error message. But this error message was sent by the Xfinity server. It means you have a program, app, or device that is periodically trying to sync email using perhaps an invalid UserID/password. If the number of login attempts exceeds the mail server's threshold it responds with that error message.

The fix is to locate the offending program, app, or device and update its settings or switch it off or stop it from auto synching.

One user said this: I had been on holiday and used my phone for a while - so I checked all devices again and then discovered my email was still logged in and running on their phone. I closed the email app on the phone and waited a couple of hours before trying to send email from the PC again. The Outgoing Server issue cleared and they haven't experienced any issues since.

Another user said this: I discovered my tablet had sync turned on for the Google Mail app and an old password for my comcast.net account. I logged into my comcast.net email account with the latest password. It downloaded all of the emails and then I turned sync off on that device. So it seems that fixing the login on my tablet has cleared this issue. I also turned off 'sync' on the tablet as I don't need to read my email on that device anymore.

You mention you have a desktop and a laptop. You need to find out if there are any other email clients auto running in the background on all devices. Also check any other device which may be trying to access the comcast account. Maybe there is a another email client operating in the background. You also need to find out whether both desktop and laptop have the correct passwords etc on both desktop and laptop.

It's also worth checking both laptop and desktop to make sure Thunderbird is all correct and up to date. Thunderbird keeps all passwords stored in this location, so you can check the password for incoming and outgoing smtp are correct - you do need to check this on both desktop and laptop.

In Thunderbird

  • Settings > Privacy & Security'
  • Scroll down to Passwords section
  • Click on 'Saved Passwords'
  • Click on 'Show Passwords'

If you have previous set up a 'Primary PAssword' then you will see the 'Use a Primary Password' checkbox was previously selected and that means Thunderbird is asking for that Primary Pasword' - this has nothing to do with mail account paswords.

If the checkbox 'Use a Primary Password' is NOT selected, so you never set that up: When you start up computer and logon to computer User Account or Microsoft account to see desktop then you need to enter that password.

Then you will be able to see the stored passwords. Please check all incoming and outgoing passwords to the user name = comcast account. Pop is mailbox://account.... Imap is imap://account... Smtp = smtp://account.... If any are not correct - Right click on line and select 'Edit Password' Completely remove all content and then type in the correct password.

Also make sure the 'username' is correct Right click on line and select 'Edit username' Completely clear and retype correct email address/username When all is ok click on Close Then Exit Thunderbird and allow some time for background processes to complete Start Thunderbird.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: This is my final comment on this matter as I have already informed of the issue and how to fix. These are the facts and at the end I've identified the likely cause. This issue has been known for a long time and in all that time the issue has never been Thunderbird and it still is not Thunderbird. Read on: 1. The error message is generated by the xfinity server and not Thunderbird. I have already explained why you get the error message. 2. Once you see the error message then Xfinity has blocked all pop, imap and smtp access. So jumping around onto other devices to keep attempting is a total waste of time - your password will be rejected and it only tells me you still do not understand what 'server blocking access' actually means. 3. It is not Thunderbird who does not like the password. It is the server who does not like it and the reason has already been explained - the server is blocking all pop imap and smtp access, so it's probably not the actual password. 4. The server will block all pop imap and smtp access for a set period of time once that error message has been generated. You are fortunate that Thunderbird has the ability to display error messages sent by the server. 5. It is blocking access because the server is getting too many attempts to logon from different apps and devices, so it thinks someone is trying to hack the account. That logon is attempts to get incoming mail or send. 6. The most common reason is usually, but not always, a phone which has a mail account set up to access emails and it has been set up to auto synch, so it is continually trying to access the server. It is important to make sure the auto sync has been switched off. 7. You need to check all devices to see whether they have other apps/programs that been set up to access the comcast account. - but as you said "Now my phone has begun receiving emails again. No rhyme or reason." - Answer and reason :The server has released the temporary block on the account and because you have got the phone mail app set up to auto sync with your comcast account then it can suddenly get access server to download mail. So now you know what is causing the problem. It is the app on the phone. It is constantly making attempts to see what is on server and download it. It's probably making these attempts every few minutes and it's doing it all the time. Most people have their phone switched on so people can phone them. Whether you are using it or not, if that phone is switched on then the app will keep pestering the server untill you switch off the auto synch meaning the app will only attempt to access the server. To fix : On phone - switch off the auto sync so it can only attmept to connect or and I would advise you do this - completely remove the comcast account from the phone mail app. You have a laptop and a desktop which can use Thunderbird, so the phone is just not necessary in your case and it's causing the problem.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
user290558199877413865350695553132054895430 said
Now I am totally consused. My phone has stopped receiving emails.

Just now you said your phone was switched off and now you say it not . It cannot receive emails because the server has applied a temporary block to your account.

As I've repeated stated. It's the server blocking the account - this issue has nothing to do with Thunderbird. You have a device constantly attempting to auto synch with server - that is what the error message is all about - and I would say it's your phone. It will keep working in the background trying to access server because you've probably got it set up on auto synch. As you are getting older then I would say you need to simplify things and start off by removing the mail account from your phone or find a good friend who can help you to disable the auto synch meaning it only works manually.

content:
Le email vengono inviate con l'account associato al server SMTP che usi per l'invio. Quindi se se per l'account A hai scelto di usare il server SMTP dell'account C, il mittente sarà C (come è ovvio che sia dato che nessun provider permette di inviare dai propri server messaggi per conto terzi).

Per ogni account puoi scegliere quale server SMTP adottare andado in Tasto menu > Impostazioni account > NOME_ACCOUNT alla voce Server in uscita (SMTP)

content: Additional information: This occurs with any email signed with an S/MIME certificate. Apparently this has been submitted as https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1843860. My default settings were to sign all emails with an S/MIME certificate. When I disabled this, and restarted Thunderbird, I was able to create forwarded messages that populated with the previous message inline i.e., the issue mostly went away. However, forwarding any received messages containing an S/MIME signature would still come up blank, with only the subject line populated (prefixed with "Fwd:"). This only occurs with the 128.6.0esr release, the previous release 128.5.2esr worked fine.

content:
Thanks @sfhowes - looks promising.

From the add-on's description, it seems like this is primarily designed to work in the reverse situation: when viewing a message in plain text, you can click a button to view it as HTML instead. And the description says that the button appears in the message header toolbar. If that's indeed where the button is, then opening the message (in HTML display) and then clicking the "open in plain text mode" button in the message header wouldn't help much. Do you use this add-on, and know where the button is displayed? Can it be activated from the inbox, before the message is opened?
creator: hommealone

content: Yes, the author seems to assume users read in plain text and occasionally need html, but it works when Original or Simple html is the default, and plain text is needed for individual messages. The button appears as in the attached picture. It can't be accessed before a message is opened (unless I've missed it), but I don't think viewing html is 'risky' or a privacy concern as long as remote content isn't enabled, which is the default.

content:
Toen ik thunderbird op mijn PC opstartte (POP) kreeg ik onderaan de melding "er zijn geen nieuwe berichten". Ik checkte de webmail van telenet en stelde vast dat er wel degelijk een paar honderd berichten te wachten stonden .... Ik probeerde de berichten te downloaden via de menu van thunderbird en toch kreeg ik opnieuw dezelfde boodschap. Een paar minuten later waren de berichten verdwenen zonder download!!! De berichten zijn nergens terug te vinden.

Ik hoop dat dit probleem zich niet meer voordoet, want hierdoor ben ik belangrijke mails kwijt geraakt. Misschien loont het de moeite om toch eens de code van thunderbird na te kijken want hietr klopt iets niet??!!
creator: eugeen.vanhoof

content:
Dat is wel vreemd. Kunt u eens proberen uw Postvak IN te repareren? Rechtermuisknop op de map > Eigenschappen > Map repareren.

Welke versie van Thunderbird gebruikt u en kunt u een schermafdruk delen van de serverinstellingen voor wat betreft de duur waarop berichten op de server moeten blijven staan?
creator: markh2

content: Ik heb het geprobeerd... zonder resultaat!! Alleszins bedankt.
creator: eugeen.vanhoof

content: Welke versie van Thunderbird gebruikt u en kunt u een schermafdruk delen van de serverinstellingen voor wat betreft de duur waarop berichten op de server moeten blijven staan?
creator: markh2

content: Zoals gevraagd.
creator: eugeen.vanhoof

content:
Ik weet niet wat het probleem heeft veroorzaakt, maar u kunt verloren gaan van berichten voorkomen door Berichten op de server laten in te schakelen en in te stellen. De standaardwaarde is 7 dagen, wat genoeg tijd zou moeten zijn om nadere maatregelen te nemen.

Schakel de netwerkverbinding van uw computer uit en start daarna Thunderbird op uw computer. U kunt dan zonder zorgen de instellingen wijzigen, omdat het ophalen van berichten bij opstarten niet mogelijk is en er dus geen berichten verloren kunnen gaan. Als u hierna de netwerkverbinding herstelt en berichten ophaalt, worden ze op de server gelaten en kunt u controleren of u dezelfde melding krijgt over geen berichten. Als dat zo is, dan zou ik aanraden het installatiepakket van Thunderbird te downloaden en over de huidige installatie heen te installeren. Na installatie kunt u dan het voorgaande herhalen om te zien of het probleem nog steeds bestaat.
creator: markh2

content:
Your previous topics are here. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/user/wwwwoolf/questions

I see a complaint about firefox today. I see this topic and I see a topic from 2 years ago about Thunderbird donations. Nothing really related to Thunderbird at all.

I know it is complicated, but posting in these support forums gets you other product users, not some paid support person. There are n paid support people for Mozilla products. So if you have something to say it has to be exact and very complete. We are completely unable to access any non public information about you or your use of the products or web sites.

"One of the messages from you said your couldnt find wwwoolf." This statement is actually meaningless in the context.

A message from whom? No one reading your text has any idea what you were doing to generate that message (actually I would consider it an error). Did you get that message in an email. From a web site?; What was the URL of the web site that gave it to you? (I have accounts on at least five Mozilla web sites. They are all different so knowing exactly what web site has an issue is critical.

My first wild guess based on zero information from you is that you have cookies or JavaScript disabled in Firefox and you therefore get issues because both are required for the PayPal website. Both of these things are enabled by default in Firefox and Thunderbird, but there are still some wayward security products that routinely disable them. There are also some folks who think they can surf the modern web without them and protect their privacy. They almost always have issues and lodge complaints about things being broken.

Is there actually a question in here about Thunderbird the mail client software? If there is I am not seeing it.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
yikes I am really sorry for being so confusing. I'm confused. I was under the impression that somehow previous messages could be viewed like in an email thread. And I don't seem to get or see the notifications when I post a question so I was really glad to see your message in an email.

The question involving Thunderbird was that I was recently trying to donate to Thunderbird after seeing an email solicitation link. When I tried to use Paypal on Firefox, I got error messages after Paypal recognized me. This is the message: "Paypal Something went wrong Please go back to MZLA Technologies Corporation and choose another way to pay. PayPal isn't available at this time."

Today I tried to purchase something using Paypal while on Firefox and kept getting " something went wrong... return to merchant" messages. But I had no issue with Safari with the purchase or donation.

So its something with the Firefox settings. I tried to add the merchant to the cookie and site exception list but maybe I didnt click Save Changes.... or designate Allow or Allow for Session. ?? I went into Firefox settings and see the merchant has cookies listed. So does Mozilla.org I don't know about Java....don't understand it or if I have it disabled. And not that every single site has a conflict with Paypal. I only use Safari if I cant use Firefox.

What I want to know is if I get another Paypal block while on Firefox, what setting do I need to change to allow the transaction to go through?
creator: wwwwoolf
